snippet: Five years after the global economy was falling the fastest, Western economies are still failing to gain much-needed momentum, despite the efforts of central bankers on both sides of the Atlantic.
abstract: Economic challenges facing United States and Europe are persistent, with latest figures on growth from US showing signs of underlying weakness as European Central Bank unexpectedly cuts interest rates to record low, reflecting threat of deflation.

byline.contributor: Jack Ewing contributed reporting from Frankfurt.

lead_paragraph: Five years after the global economy was falling the fastest, Western economies are still failing to gain much-needed momentum, despite the efforts of central bankers on both sides of the Atlantic.

headline.main: Growth Gain Blurs Signs of Weakness in Economy
headline.print_headline: Growth Gain Blurs Signs Of Weakness In Economy
